// REQUIRED FIELDS: These fields must be filled out to create a job
purchase_order_number: FILL_ME_IN - Your ETS PS or QR number for tracking
client_name: FILL_ME_IN - Client company name (e.g., 'Woolworths', 'ABC Property Management')
// SITE INFORMATION: Physical location where work will be performed
job_address: FILL_ME_IN - Site address where work will be performed (include street, suburb, state, postcode)
// SITE CONTACT: Person to contact at the physical site
site_contact_name: FILL_ME_IN - Name of person at site for access/coordination
site_contact_phone: FILL_ME_IN - Mobile/phone number for site contact
job_description: FILL_ME_IN - Include: Site/location name, detailed work required, and for CRITICAL jobs add: *** CRITICAL - 24x7 EMERGENCY ***
category_uuid: FILL_ME_IN - Job category UUID (see provided list)
special_instructions: OPTIONAL - Any site-specific instructions or requirements
queue_uuid: For CRITICAL jobs use: 3a8029ef-b239-4c2e-a18f-215f7964552b (TEE New Job queue)

// INSTRUCTIONS.1: Fill out all fields marked 'FILL_ME_IN' above
// INSTRUCTIONS.3: DO NOT change any fields in the 'DO NOT CHANGE' section
// INSTRUCTIONS.4: Job is created under ETS company (Emergency Trade Services)
// INSTRUCTIONS.5: Client name identifies who requested the work
// INSTRUCTIONS.6: Site is the physical address where work will be performed
// INSTRUCTIONS.7: CRITICAL JOBS: Set priority to 'Critical' for life-threatening/24x7 emergencies - automatically assigns to TEE New Job queue
// INSTRUCTIONS.8: Site contact will be added for on-site coordination
// INSTRUCTIONS.9: After job creation, send Network Request to Sustaine through ServiceM8 interface
// INSTRUCTIONS.10: Sustaine accepts job and invoices internally (not to ETS client)

// CRITICAL WORK CRITERIA.Examples: Power failure at hospital, exposed live wires, emergency lighting failure, critical infrastructure failure
// CRITICAL WORK CRITERIA.Response: Immediate dispatch via TEE New Job queue
